text:
Hi foc 2mw, I'm writing a weekly newsletter on engineering productivity, so i thought this might be a good place to both share the content as well as talk about how the sausage is made.

This week I wrote about using JSON as a lingua franca, it's an productivity technique I've been dogfooding for a couple of years.
<https://codefaster.substack.com/p/make-json-your-lingua-franca|https://codefaster.substack.com/p/make-json-your-lingua-franca>

Writing it was surprisingly hard. I LOVE this idea, but after using it for so long, it feels so obvious. I have no idea how else I would solve the problem. If someone was reading this, why wouldn't they jump out of their seat? Isn't this so great it doesn't need explaination? Of course it does. And I need to develop a better sense for the reader's mindset to make more valuable content.

attachments.title: Make JSON your lingua franca
attachments.text: Making json your lingua franca means making json the way you and your programs represent data, with few exceptions.
